多謝支持先，我絲嚟
我覺得英國學車考車制度好完善，要考3個test先做到教車師傅，篩選好嚴格，我見過我師傅佢有張成績表樣樣都有分數比架(有冇耐性、係咪觀察細心、可以比到學生確切嘅意見等等)
無論係theory test定show me tell me questions，可以考你對車夠唔夠認識，

係reverse around a corner比較多餘，但依家新制都已經取消咗啦

至於排期，我冇資料因為間間test centre唔同，應該唔會多過三個月嘅，我呢度周街learner都唔超過三個月

你對自己有信心覺得自己上多幾堂就可以考嗰陣就上去book
https://www.gov.uk/book-driving-test

你book完之後日日上去昅吓，日日都會有人取消booking，你可以就打尖sip佢哋個位，當然最好選10點 11點 1點 呢啲非繁忙時間

衰咗可以上網即刻再排過，同樣地如果有空位你可以sip入去，但距離你fail咗嗰日一定要過咗最少10個工作天

考私家車pass左筆試，考電單車時唔洗再考？

一定要再考

英國又有幾多種車牌？貨車的士果d洗唔洗夠牌齡先考得？

喺driving licence後面列咗15種，不過係
貨車冇限制,幾時考都得 不過程序都幾麻煩 https://www.gov.uk/become-lorry-bus-driver/getting-qualified
的士就要渣住車牌1年先考得 london內外考法唔同 https://www.gov.uk/taxi-driver-licence
london裡面難考到痴線唔係自虐都唔洗諗，睇過一篇文講有幾難考睇見已經覺得痴線

我都識勁多人喺英國考唔到就走去香港考...仲聽聞有人操咗一個禮拜都pass到香港路試...唉

全球大部分國家都有licence exchange協議
英國接受嘅國家有呢啲 Australia, Barbados, British Virgin Islands, Canada, Falkland Islands, Faroe Islands, Gibraltar, Hong Kong, Japan, Monaco, New Zealand, Republic of Korea, Singapore, South Africa, Switzerland and Zimbabwe.
你要喺英國住咗185日先可以轉做英國牌

比較有趣嘅係香港轉唔到日本牌
同埋有啲國家轉牌有限制，例如加拿大BC，牌齡唔夠2年只可以轉做BC嘅N牌

今日學完車可能因為唔夠瞓所以做左d柒事
個instructor話如果下堂再係咁會叫我改時間

同埋想講對比香港 英國真係唔算易
太窄 差唔多冇可能操熟某兩條線就ok
因為有幾十條route

有冇人可以解答join a road/motorway時
後面車冇鬆油或轉線時

你係指join dual carriageway? 同join普通公路唔同個喎，有啲公路join嗰陣要give way可以停，但dual carriageway一定有slip road 你嗰個時候應該已經加速到接近70mph，梗係唔可以停

join嗰陣要加速減速好睇情況 你要睇吓後面架車嘅距離幾秒之內作出決定
我考嗰陣係有架大貨車喺後面嚟緊所以我即刻3波谷到70先join，事後考官有讚我

Single carriageway都可以有雙線
喺我篇嘢裡面已經解釋咗分別


Single carriageway=冇分隔嘅雙向行車道，限速60mph (96km/h)。多數係郊外先有。
Dual Carriageway=有分隔（欄杆、草叢等等）嘅雙向行車道，限速70mph (112km/h)。同motorway唔同在於佢冇hard shoulder（即係路肩=一條多出嚟嘅行車線比緊急車過或者壞車入去停低），得layby（壞車停車位），但有時連layby都冇。另外未考到牌係唔可以上motorway嘅。

唔洗個喎,只要証明你住夠6個月就OK

你符合以下三項申請資格的其中一項：
you satisfy one of the three requirements below:
(i)該執照原本是你在發出該執照的國家或地方居留不少
於6個月的期間發出的(證明文件包括有關護照以顯示出入境記錄或官方簽發的出入境證明，以及你在當地學校的成績，或受聘公司發給的聘用期間證明文件等)；或
the licence was originally issued to you on any date during a period of residence of not less than 6 months in the country or place of issue (supporting documents include the relevant passport showing records of entry and departure or an official statement of travel records, and your school transcript or employer’s testimonial with employment period specified, etc.); or
(ii)緊接本申請表呈交日期之前，該執照已簽發給你不少於五年；或
the licence has been issued to you for not less than 5 years immediately prior to the application; or
(iii)
你持有發出該執照的國家或地方所發的護照或同等旅行證件。
you hold a passport or an equivalent travel document issued in the country or place in which your licence was issued.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-16996938

For those of you with a Hong Kong permanent ID card and UK driving licence, you may not use your UK driving licence in Hong Kong as a visitor. A court case in September 2016 - HKSAR vs Tsui Pak Sun Paxton and another (HCMA50/2016) meant that a Hong Kong permanent ID card holder with an overseas driving licence may not be class as a visitor in Hong Kong unless he enters and leaves Hong Kong with a foreign passport. If you are not class as a visitor in Hong Kong, then you will need a Hong Kong driving licence in order to drive in Hong Kong.

運輸署覆我


申請人需同時符合以下其中一項規定：
1. 該執照是申請人在簽發國家或地方居留不少過6個月的期間簽發
請留意：除連續6個月外，該駕駛執照也是在該6個月居留的期間發出的。
- 該6個月居留期間如申請人的是暫准牌(P牌)，亦會計算於上述有關條件的時限內
- 如申請人於6個月的期間曾離開當地，他必須向運輸署提供合理解釋，運輸署會按申請人的實際情況作出考慮，必須提供居留的目的並提交相關証明文件如工作証明、讀書証明等等，而申請人所提供的證明文件須顯示他在當地居留6個月及在該6個月期間取得執照。 旅遊及監禁並不符合此項條件。)；或
2. 在申請前已持有該認可國家或地方的駕駛執照不少於五年（暫准駕駛執照的持有期也計算在內）；或
3. 持有該執照簽發國家或地方的護照或同等的旅行證件，該等證件必須仍然有效。

請注意：非正式海外駕駛執照(如學習執照或暫准執照)並不可以申請免試簽發香港任何類別的駕駛執照。

如申請人符合以上資格填妥指定申請表格TD63A(免試簽發香港正式駕駛執照申請書)及連同以下所需文件交回香港牌照事務處辦理。
- 如遞交申請時已持有任何車種的香港駕駛執照，申請人須同時提交表格TD557及其所需文件以辦理加領正式駕駛執照。

1. 申請人的香港身分證正本及副本，如沒有香港身分證：有效的任何本地或海外護照或同等旅行證件正本及副本；
2. 海外駕駛執照正本及副本；
3. 如持有的海外駕駛執照沒有中文或英文說明，則須附有官方承認的譯本，包括：
(a) 發出該駕駛執照的國家駐香港領事館所提供的譯本；或
(b) 由在香港登記的翻譯公司的翻譯員所提供的宣誓譯本（翻譯員須到民政事務處宣誓，証明其翻譯正確）。
4. 以下其中一份的證明文件的正本及副本
(a) 證明持有該認可國家或地方的駕駛執照不少於5年的文件；
(b) 該駕駛執照簽發國家或地方的有效護照或同等的旅行證件；或
(c) 證明該執照是申請人在簽發國家或地方連續居留不少過6個月期間簽發的文件（證明文件包括：
(i) 有關護照以顯示入境及出境蓋印；或官方簽發的出入境證明；
(**官方簽發的出入境證明是指申請人在該海外國家官方發出的證明文件。
例如 申請人持澳洲正式駕駛執照並在該國居留6個月期間發出，申請人需提供澳洲官方發出的出入境記錄文件**)
以及
(ii) 申請人在當地學校的成績表或受聘公司發出的聘用期間證明等）。
注意：
如申請人於該6個月的期間曾離開當地，必須向運輸署提供合理解釋，以作考慮。
5. 地址證明的正本或副本

You need to be a visitor in order to drive in Hong Kong using a non Hong Kong driving licence. Under the court case HCMA 50/2016, a judge use that anyone with a Hong Kong Permanent ID card who enter Hong Kong using his or her Hong Kong Permanent ID card cannot be class as a visitor.

The judge in this court case suggests that if you are a dual national - for example a British Citizen and a HKSAR passport holder, as long as you enter Hong Kong using your British Citizen passport, you can be class as a visitor in Hong Kong and can use your UK driving licence to drive in Hong Kong.

If you have a car licence

Do I still need to take a motorcycle theory test if I have passed a car theory test?

You can continue to drive in the UK without exchanging your licence for 12 months after becoming resident.

After 12 months you must exchange your licence to keep driving. You can exchange it up to 5 years after becoming resident, if it hasn’t expired.

Order form D1 from the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA).
Send the form, £43 fee and any documents you need (including your driving licence) to the address on the form.

Sorry I think you misunderstand the meaning of this sentence. What it means is that as a Hong Kong driving licence holder, you can drive in the UK for 12 months without the need to exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one.

Once you become a resident in the UK, which means that you have spent at lease 6 months in the UK, you can exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one. You have 5 years to exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one as long as your Hong Kong driving licence is valid at the time. It does not mean that you will be given an UK driving licence for 5 years!

In the UK, the photocard driving licence is valid for 10 years. You will need to supply a new photo to DVLA every 10 years, however, your driving entitlement is valid until your 70th birthday.

Sorry I think you misunderstand the meaning of this sentence. What it means is that as a Hong Kong driving licence holder, you can drive in the UK for 12 months without the need to exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one.

Once you become a resident in the UK, which means that you have spent at lease 6 months in the UK, you can exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one. You have 5 years to exchange your Hong Kong driving licence to an UK one as long as your Hong Kong driving licence is valid at the time. It does not mean that you will be given an UK driving licence for 5 years!

In the UK, the photocard driving licence is valid for 10 years. You will need to supply a new photo to DVLA every 10 years, however, your driving entitlement is valid until your 70th birthday.

There are two stages to get British Citizenship.

You will need to get Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) (永久居留) first. Put it simply, you can get ILR after 5 years in the UK if you are on a Tier 2 (General) Work Permit or a spouse visa after meeting certain conditions. You can only count your days as a student in the UK in 10 years long resident route.

https://www.gov.uk/long-residence/overview

You can apply for British Citizenship a year after getting ILR. The 5 year rule is for registration / naturalisation to become a British Citizen. You do not need to wait for a year if you are married to a British Citizen.

東網透視：憑一支單簧管　香港仔入選御林軍

以香港第一人身份成爲英國御林軍樂手，David憶述，源於幾年前一次聚餐時偶遇英國陸軍音樂總監，對方提起英國御林軍樂隊招募新隊員，他持有英國國民(海外)護照(BNO)身份也可參與招聘考試，故決定一試。軍樂隊考試分兩部分，體能為先，音樂第二。對於當年33歲的他來說，體能測試是極大的挑戰，要10分半鐘內跑完2.4公里，亦要做掌上壓及仰臥起坐，首輪面試因跑步不達標而失敗。但他並沒有放棄，返港苦操3、4個月後再接受挑戰，2013年過關斬將通過所有測試，成功取錄。

身為英皇室的御林軍，薪酬福利令人關注，David則不予透露，僅指薪金水平較香港警察低一些，除普通的醫療和交通福利外，最優厚是住房福利，他與同事在倫敦市中心合住一間800至900平方呎單位，月租只需30英鎊，僅相當於300港元，相信令不少香港青年人羨慕。他現長居英國，還有一年便可入籍，目標是繼續在軍隊攀升，成爲終身職業。

http://hk.on.cc/hk/bkn/cnt/news/20170812/bkn-20170812093047180-0812_00822_001.html

You can get a taste of British Army life by joining your university's Officers' Training Corp.

http://www.army.mod.uk/UOTC/28464.aspx

an unlimited fine

Test centres in the countryside usually has a higher pass rate than those in the urban areas. Have a look at the link below to find out which test centre near you has a higher pass rate -

https://www.gov.uk/government/statistical-data-sets/car-driving-test-data-by-test-centre

One more warning for you - if you are thinking of passing your driving test in the UK and then drive in Hong Kong using your UK driving licence as a 'visitor', then you may found yourself in hot water if you hold a Hong Kong ID card and use it to enter Hong Kong. replies.msg:
Given the above legal test case noted above, the best thing for you to do is to pass your driving test both in Hong Kong and the UK as you need to drive in Hong Kong and the UK.

You can only drive in the UK for one year using your Hong Kong issued international driving permit.

The UK national average for driving test pass rate is 47% (6 months up to September 2017). For driving test in Wales, you can have a look at doing it in Brecon (pass rate of 64.4%) and Pwllheli (60.7%), which is higher than Cardiff (51.3%) and Newport (Gwent) (49.6%).

Okay, so even I got an international license (issued in HK), I can only use it for 1 year in UK? And so the only way is to pass the driving test in both UK and HK? Is there a way I can use one license and drive in both places?

Thanks for the other information

replies.msg:
The only way you can do this legally is if you have a foreign passport. Once you passed your test in the UK, you can drive as a visitor in Hong Kong if you entered Hong Kong using your foreign passport. Enter Hong Kong using your Hong Kong Permanent ID card could resulted in you being class as a 'local' person - not entitle to use your foreign driving licence in Hong Kong.

In HKSAR v. TSUI PAK SUN, PAXTON AND ANOTHER, the judge said that -

33. Construing the definition of “visitor” in its proper context, I take the view that it only applies to visitors from abroad and generally does not apply to Hong Kong permanent residents having the right of abode in Hong Kong. I say it is a general position as I can envisage that there may still be exception in some cases. Accordingly, I am reluctant to go down the path as suggested by the respondent that this definition does not apply to Hong Kong Permanent Identity Card holders at all. In reality, there may be cases where a Hong Kong permanent resident may also be regarded as a visitor as a result of his or her own choosing. We know many permanent residents in Hong Kong are also passport holders of other foreign countries. According to Schedule 1 of the Immigration Ordinance, Cap 115, the status of a permanent resident in Hong Kong of Chinese nationality would never be lost even if he or she is absent from Hong Kong continuously for many years and cease to have ordinarily resided in Hong Kong. In simple language, over the years many Hong Kong residents chose to immigrate to western countries such as Australia, Canada, USA or UK. For those Chinese citizens from Hong Kong, they would still be permanent Hong Kong residents even though they have been living abroad continuously for so many years and ordinarily reside in that foreign country. However, when they subsequently come back to Hong Kong for holidays, for reasons best known to themselves, they can still choose to return as “visitors” by entering with their foreign passports and not by their Hong Kong Permanent Identity Cards.

34. This is a simple question of fact as far as evidence is concerned and it is also a clear and unequivocal manifestation of such a permanent resident’s real intention as to whether he or she should be regarded as a “permanent resident” or a “visitor”. In those cases where the Hong Kong Permanent Identity Card holders still chose to enter Hong Kong by their foreign passports, I judge it would be wrong and illogical to disregard their conscious decisions and not to treat them as “visitors” as such. Therefore, I do think it is appropriate and I decline to resolve the issue by a general sweeping statement proposed by the respondent that a Hong Kong Permanent Identity Card holder can never be a “visitor”. Clearly, a whole host of the factors should be considered in the weighing exercise. If however a permanent Hong Kong resident with a foreign passport chose to use his or her permanent identity card to enter and leave Hong Kong as opposed to his or her foreign passport, whilst not conclusive, this will strongly suggest that he or she was not a “visitor”.

Thank you for your enquiry received on 25/1/2018.
Your case reference number is 0044852
The rules for exchanging your non-GB driving licence with us will depend on the type of licence you currently hold, please see the advice below depending on which licence you currently hold.

Please note: Your driving licence will not be returned to you. We must send it to the issuing authority as part of our exchange agreement.


Designated Countries

The countries we have a designated exchange agreement are:

Andorra, Australia, Barbados, British Virgin Islands, Canada, Falkland Islands, Faroe Islands, Hong Kong, Japan, Monaco, New Zealand, Republic of Korea, Singapore, South Africa, Switzerland and Zimbabwe.

As long as you passed your test in one of these countries you can apply to exchange a valid driving licence within 5 years of becoming resident in GB.

We can only exchange car and motorcycle entitlement, not lorries or buses.

You’ll need to complete a D1 application form for cars or motorbikes. These can be ordered here. Alternatively, you can get one from selected Post Offices® that offer driving licence transactions.

Remember:

To include the relevant ID
To include your current driving licence (if you have lost it, please mention this on the form)
To include 1 Passport standard photograph
The fee is £43.00
What ID do I need to send?

You will need to send proof of your identity with the application. Please see here for further advice.

Where should I send the application?

DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1BT

How long will it take?

Please allow up to 3 weeks for your provisional driving licence to be sent to you. This can take longer if we need to check your health or personal details.

Your identity documents will be returned separately, normally arriving within 3 weeks of receiving your licence.

Please note: If you hold a lorry or bus driving licence after passing a test in Gibraltar or Switzerland you can exchange these entitlements using a D2 form instead of a D1.

you satisfy one of the three requirements below:

於6個月的期間發出的(證明文件包括有關護照以顯示出入境記錄或官方簽發的出入境證明，以及你在當地學校的成績，或受聘公司發給的聘用期間證明文件等)；或

(ii)緊接本申請表呈交日期之前，該執照已簽發給你不少於五年；或
the licence has been issued to you for not less than 5 years immediately prior to the application; or
(iii)
你持有發出該執照的國家或地方所發的護照或同等旅行證件。
you hold a passport or an equivalent travel document issued in the country or place in which your licence was issued.

【港前女警離奇死】5日4單搶劫專吼華人 英退休輔警解謎思

https://hk.news.appledaily.com/china/realtime/article/20180517/58199869

倫敦退休輔警、依士靈頓華人協會行政總裁吳呂南向《蘋果》表示，開設餐館和外賣的華人肯定會將營業的現金存放在家中收藏，最大誘因為逃稅撇賬，遂成為歹徒有機可乘的搶劫目標。

「華人通常揸一部靚嘅汽車，靚車自然俾人跟蹤嘅線索之一。」吳解釋，過去歹徒破門而入也是屢見不鮮，而華人被竊後不敢太過張揚，選擇忍氣吞氣，向警方報出一個較小的數目，華人在家中儲藏大量現金的積習至今未有改變。

曾當過輔警的他認為，警方透過閉路電視追查3名疑犯的犯罪證據，又追查到其中一人疑犯在案發不久到兌換店兌換外幣，而外幣的數目與被竊的數目相近，但估計在DNA、指模等種種原因證據不足下，未能在毫無疑點下證明3人曾入屋爆竊，因而要拘留期滿後將各人釋放。

根據第四頻道訪問當地的一名華人表示，在梁杏燕在家被洗劫的時間，即去年1月31日至2月4日期間，當地就發生4宗中國家庭被搶劫的案件。鍾說：「自己家幾乎每年都會被搶劫，他們已經完全不信任和指望警察能幹甚麼了。」

究竟為甚麼罪犯覷準華人家庭作為目標？在英國居住30多年、從事餐飲業的港人木先生向《蘋果》記者表示，歹徒一般會踩線跟蹤華人，而外賣店一般在家中存放大批現金，容易成為歹徒洗劫的目標，洗劫時會翻箱倒籠肆意破壞，一般需要全屋大裝修。他又指，倫敦等大城市報案後警方通常會及時調查，但小鎮警力較薄弱，如果沒有傷人或死人，可能報警後5至6小時才抵達現場。他稱，經營外賣店的華人通常自行安裝閉路電視，但歹徒也會預早將閉路電視截斷或拆走，所以華人只能自求多福。

目前居住倫敦屈福特（Watford）的港人蔡小姐表示，移居英國逾20年，發現近年英國治安都較以往惡劣。蔡小姐稱，歹徒多以中國人或印度人作目標，因為賊人往往覺得這兩個國家的人住所有許多「唔見得光」的錢，即使他們被劫也不會報警。

蔡小姐指，華人被劫的個案不時發現，大部份案件都是發生於治安較差的曼徹斯特，而死者梁杏燕居住的地區治安普通。今年1月，曼徹斯特華埠街坊商會曾發出通告，指蘇格蘭格拉斯哥警方，於當地拘捕多名懷疑保加利亞或羅馬尼亞籍的年輕男子。搜查期間，被捕人士身上持有英國各地多名華裔人士之姓名，地址，電話等個人資料，資料與英國各地華人住所被爆竊，入屋行劫之名單脗合。通告提醒當地華人，小心門戶及個人安全。
